perturbation.original_text:
Any controversy between the parties arising under this Agreement and not resolved by the parties shall be determined in
accordance with the laws of the State of Michigan.
perturbation.changed_text: Any controversy between the parties arising under this Agreement and not resolved by the parties shall be determined by binding arbitration, waiving all rights to pursue claims in a court of law. The arbitration must commence within 60 days of the dispute arising, regardless of any statutory limitation periods.
perturbation.explanation: This change forces binding arbitration, potentially waiving rights to a jury trial guaranteed by law. Additionally, setting a 60-day limit to commence arbitration contradicts Michigan's statute of limitations for contract disputes, which is typically longer (6 years). This unreasonably shortens the time to pursue a claim, potentially barring valid legal recourse.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Michigan Statute of Limitations for Contract Disputes, Right to Jury Trial
